affiliation.ja: 高エネルギー加速器研究機構

research_field.ja: 素粒子、原子核、宇宙線、宇宙物理にする理論
research_field.en: Theoretical studies related to particle-, nuclear-, cosmic ray and astro-physics

paper_title.ja: J‐PARC主リング高繰り返し化における多極磁場の評価
paper_title.en: J‐PARC主リング高繰り返し化における多極磁場の評価
Design and test of 2-4MHz sawtooth-wave pre-buncher for 26MHz-RFQ

description.en: The measurement of 12C(α,γ) reaction is planned at TRIAC(Tokai Radioactive Ion Accelerator Complex). An intense pulsed a beam with the width of less 10ns and the interval between 250ns and 500ns is required for this experiment. Because the Split Coaxial RFQ (SCRFQ), which is one of the TRIAC accelerators, has a radio frequency of 26MHz, the bunch interval becomes 38.5ns. In order to make the bunch interval of 250ns or more, the pre-buncher with a variable frequency of 2-4MHz, is considered to be installed upstream of the SCRFQ. It is designed as the pre-buncher has two gaps with non-π mode. In order to make the bunching beam profile like a pseudo sawtooth-wave, the RF voltage synthesized three harmonic frequencies is applied to these gaps. Consequently, the pre-buncher has a compact size and no leakage electric field outside gaps, and can keep the RF voltage low. The beam test of this pre-buncher with a 2MHz was perormed using 16O4+ and 12C3+ beams. The clear bunch structure with a interval of 500ns was obtained by the SSD set downstream of the SCRFQ. The results of the beam test are almost consistent with those of the beam simulation code.

paper_title.en: Beam test of sawtooth-wave pre-buncher coupled to a multilayer chopper

description.en: In TRIAC (Tokai Radioactive Ion Accelerator Complex), intense bunched α beams will be utilized for measurements of 12C(α, γ)16O reactions. Sawtooth-wave pre-buncher has been developed for satisfying the experimental conditions. In order to remove the background particles, a multilayer chopper have been installed upstream the pre-buncher. The chopper has 19 electrodes (40mm wide, 10mm long, and 0.1mm thick) piled up with gaps of 1.9mm in vertically to the beam direction and a square-shape electric potential (120V in maximum, 2-4 MHz in repetition frequency) is applied to each electrode alternately. The short gap makes it possible to realize sharp chopping with relatively low electric potential and weak leakage electric field, although beam particles could be lost by 5% or more, since this chopper is set on the way of beam. As a result, this pre-bunch system achieves intense bunched beam with little background.

paper_title.en: An Experimental Plan to Study Beta-decay Properties on N=126 Waiting-Point Nuclei in the r-process

description.en: The beta-decay properties of the neutron-rich isotopes with neutron number N = 126, out of reach by any reaction well established so far, are very interesting from the astrophysical point of view. We will propose beta-decay lifetime measurements with a new isotope separation system, which is supposed to separate a single species of the radioactive nuclei among target-like fragments produced via multi-nucleon transfer reactions in binary heavy ion collisions, by using a gas catcher cell combined with laser resonance ionization technique. The present proposal aims to measure beta-decay properties of several nuclei around A similar to 200 with N = 126 and nearby nuclei by using a stable Xe-136 beam on a Pt-198 target.

publication_name.en: 10TH INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIUM ON ORIGIN OF MATTER AND EVOLUTION OF GALAXIES

paper_title.ja: Single and double delta production in the [Formula Presented]He[Formula Presented] reaction at 380⩽[Formula Presented] MeV
paper_title.en: Single and double delta production in the [Formula Presented]He[Formula Presented] reaction at 380⩽[Formula Presented] MeV

description.ja: Results are presented for the [Formula Presented]He[Formula Presented] reaction in the region 380 [Formula Presented] MeV, investigated with the use of a 10% duty factor tagged photon beam, in conjunction with the TAGX multiparticle spectrometer. The study of such multipion photoproduction reactions has motivated a number of chiral symmetric models, and is expected to provide an insight on the role of the [Formula Presented] and [Formula Presented] resonances in the nuclear medium. From comparisons of the data with simple reaction simulations, it was found that the data were best fit with a combination of multibody phase space channels, quasifree [Formula Presented] and [Formula Presented], and [Formula Presented] production channels. The results are compared with other double pion photoproduction reactions on hydrogen and deuterium. © 1997 The American Physical Society.
description.en: Results are presented for the [Formula Presented]He[Formula Presented] reaction in the region 380 [Formula Presented] MeV, investigated with the use of a 10% duty factor tagged photon beam, in conjunction with the TAGX multiparticle spectrometer. From comparisons of the data with simple reaction simulations, it was found that the data were best fit with a combination of multibody phase space channels, quasifree [Formula Presented] and [Formula Presented], and [Formula Presented] production channels. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Beam Transport Design of the Heavy Ion Linacs at the JAERI-KEK Joint Facility

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the 26th Linean Accelerator Meeting in Japan

paper_title.en: A 25.5 MHz double-coaxial lambda/4-resonator as a rebuncher in heavy ion linac system

description.en: A 25.5 MHz double-coaxial lambda/4-resonator has been constructed to be used as a rebuncher between a 25.5 MHz RFQ linac and a 51 MHz interdigital-H linac for the acceleration of short-lived nuclei. By employing a double coaxial structure, the resonator length is only 130 cm; the length of the natural lambda/4-resonator is 294 cm. The resonator, 69 cm in inner diameter, has six acceleration gaps. The bare shunt impedance is 40.6 M Omega/m. The ions with a charge-to-mass ratio 1/10 can be rebunched by feeding an rf power of 1.4 kW. (C) 1999 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT

paper_title.en: Measurements of the Longitudinal Emittances of the RFQ/IH Linac by using a SSD(共著)

publication_name.en: Proceeding of the 24th Linear Accelerator Meeting in Japan, 1999

paper_title.en: The RB facility at KEK-Tanashi

description.en: An ISOL-based radioactive nuclear beam facility at KEK-Tanashi has been constructed. The linac complex to accelerate radioactive beams comprises a 25.5 MHz split coaxial RFQ (SCRFQ) and a 51 MHz interdigital-H (IH) linac, and accelerates heavy ions up to 1 MeV/u. Beam tests using stable nuclear beam have been done in order to examine the performance of the linacs. Acceleration tests of a radioactive nuclear beam was also performed. This facility is a prototype for the exotic nuclei arena (E-arena) of the proposed Japanese Hadron Facility (JHF), in which 3 GeV,10 mu A protons is used as a primary beam, and a radioactive nuclear beam is accelerated up 6.5 MeV/u by an extension of the IH linac. In this paper, outline, present status and future plan of the facility are reported with emphasis on the heavy ion linacs.

paper_title.en: Acceleration test of radioactive nuclear beam at INS

description.en: First acceleration test of a radioactive nuclear beam was performed in a radioactive beam facility at INS. The Ne-19 beam was produced by bombarding a LiF target with 30 MeV protons from an SF cyclotron, and ionized by a ECR ion source. We succeeded to accelerate the Ne-19(2+) ions to 0.72 MeV/u by heavy-ion linacs. The intensity delivered to a secondary target is not yet enough. Further improvements will be done to perform experiments using accelerated radioactive nuclei.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 1997 PARTICLE ACCELERATOR CONFERENCE, VOLS 1-3

paper_title.en: Construction and beam tests of a 25.5 MHz split coaxial RFQ for radioactive nuclei

description.en: A 25.5 MHz split coaxial RFQ with modulated vanes has been constructed at INS. The RFQ will accelerate radioactive nuclei with a charge-to-mass ratio greater than 1/30 from 2 to 172 keV/u. The cavity, 0.9 m in inner diameter and 8.6 m in length, comprises four unit cavities, each of which comprises three module cavities further. The modulated vanes have been made by using both of a three-dimensional cutting technique and a two-dimensional one, the former for the first unit cavity, and the latter for the other ones. The transverse radius of curvature of the vane-tip is variable along the beam axis in a low-energy part, and constant in a high-energy part (the boundary at 1.1 m down from the RFQ entrance). The vanes have been aligned with an error less than +/- 40 mu m before installation in the unit cavities. After completion of the four unit cavities, they have been aligned with an error less than +/- 50 mu m on the floor of an accelerator room. Low-power tests after cavity-tuning show that the longitudinal voltage flatness and the azimuthal field balance are better than +/- 1%, the resonant frequency is 25.46 MHz, and the unloaded Q-value is 5800, corresponding to a resonant resistance of 22 k Omega. We have achieved so far the goal intervane voltage of 109 kV at a duty factor of 15%. Through acceleration tests with N+ ions, we have obtained the following results: the output-beam emittances are well in the design ellipses of 0.06 pi cm mrad normalized; the data of transmission efficiency versus intervane voltage agree well with PARMTEQ results and the transmission at the nominal voltage is measured to be 90%.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT

paper_title.en: New ISOL-based radioactive nuclear beam facility at INS

description.en: `An ISOL-based radioactive nuclear beam facility is just about to come into operation at INS. The present status of the INS radioactive nuclear beam project is reported. The capability of the facility and possible experiments are also discussed, including research programs of nuclear physics and nuclear astrophysics.

paper_title.en: Single and double delta production in the He-3(gamma,pi(+)pi(-)) reaction at 380<=E-gamma<=700 MeV

description.en: Results are presented for the He-3(gamma, pi(+)pi(-)) reaction in the region 380 less than or equal to E-gamma less than or equal to 700 MeV, investigated with the use of a 10% duly factor tagged photon beam, in conjunction with the TAGX multiparticle spectrometer. The study of such multipion photoproduction reactions has motivated a number of chiral symmetric models, and is expected to provide an insight on the role of the Delta and N* resonances in the nuclear medium. From comparisons of the data with simple reaction simulations, it was found that the data were best Bt with a combination of multibody phase space channels, quasifree Delta and N*, and Delta Delta production channels. The results are compared with other double pion photoproduction reactions on hydrogen and deuterium.

paper_title.en: A step-like rise in the He-4(gamma, pn)H-2 cross section near the pion-production threshold

description.en: A kinematically complete He-4(gamma,pn)H-2 measurement was carried out in the photon energy (E(gamma),) range 145-425 MeV, The total cross section (sigma(alpha)) forms a prominent structure whose peak lies at E(gamma) similar to 245 MeV (the pnd invariant mass of 3960 MeV/c(2)). The ratio sigma(alpha)/sigma(d), where sigma(d) is the deuteron photodisintegration cross section, shows a step-like rise to a value of 6 at E(gamma) similar to 140 MeV.

paper_title.en: The large-acceptance spectrometer TAGX for photoreaction studies at the 1.3-GeV Tokyo electron synchrotron

description.en: The study of photoreactions on light nuclei with the TAGX spectrometer started in 1987 using the 20% duty-cycle tagged-photon beam at the 1.3-GeV Tokyo electron synchrotron. TAGX is comprised of a pi-sr magnetic spectrometer for detection of charged pions, kaons, and protons and a 0.85-sr time-of-flight spectrometer for neutrons. It has served in the past eight years as a unique medium-energy-resolution multi-particle spectrometer for coincidence experiments to detect such final states as pn, pp, pi(+) pi(-), ppn, pp pi(-), and pn pi(+)pi(-): some of which were kinematically-complete measurements of three-particle and four-particle final states. Details of the detector components, their performance. data acquisition, event reconstruction analyses, and detector-acceptance calculations are described together with the results of experience acquired in those experiments. A TAGX improvement in the momentum resolution required for charged particle measurements in the 1-GeV photon energy region is also reported.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT

paper_title.en: Status of the INS Heavy Ion Linac for Short-Lived Nuclear Beams

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the 6th China-Japan Joint Symposium on Accelerators

paper_title.en: Beam test results of the INS RFQ/IH linac

description.en: A linac complex for radioactive beams has been constructed at INS, which comprises a 25.5-MHz split coaxial RFQ (SCRFQ) with modulated vanes and a 51-MHz interdigital-H (M) linac. The SCRFQ accelerates ions with a charge-to-mass ratio (q/A) greater than 1/30 from 2 to 172 keV/u. The beam from the SCRFQ is charge-stripped by a carbon-foil, and is transported to the M: linac through two magnetic-quadrupole doublets and a 25.5-MHz rebuncher cavity. The IH linac accelerates ions with a q/A greater than 1/10, and the output energy is variable in the range of 0.17 through 1.05 MeV/u. Beam tests of the linac complex performed with N2+ ions show that the output beam energy and transmission efficiency agree well with predictions.

publication_name.en: PROCEEEDINGS OF THE XVIII INTERNATIONAL LINEAR ACCELERATOR CONFERENCE, VOLS 1 AND 2

paper_title.en: Progress Report of the interdigital-H Linac for Radioactive Nuclei at INS

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the 5th European Particle Accelerator Conference

paper_title.en: First beam tests of the INS split coaxial RFQ for radioactive nuclei

paper_title.en: QUASI-FREE K+ PHOTOPRODUCTION IN C-12

description.en: Quasi-free K+ photo-production in the C-12(gamma, K+) reaction has been investigated in a photon energy range of 0.7-1.1 GeV. Differential cross sections for the quasi-free process of the C-12(gamma, K+) reaction have been obtained and they are compared with a calculation of a quasi-free K+ photo-production. The effective proton number Z(eff) = 4.2 +/- 0.6 obtained from the experiment was in good agreement with a calculation of a semi-classical attenuation model.

paper_title.en: TOTAL CROSS-SECTION FOR PHOTON-ABSORPTION BY 2 PROTONS IN HE-3

description.en: The He-3(gamma, pp)n reaction was investigated in the photon energy range 200-500 MeV using the spectrometer TAGX, which has a solid angle for protons of pi sr. Two types of photon absorption, one by two protons and the other by three nucleons, were observed by looking at the undetected neutron momentum distributions. The total cross section for photon absorption by two protons shows that this process is consistent with the E2 transition.

paper_title.en: 3-BODY HE-3 PHOTODISINTEGRATION IN THE DELTA-REGION

description.en: Three-body He-3 photodisintegration was measured in the photon energy range (E(gamma)) of 145-425 MeV. The total cross section for photon absorption on the np pairs in He-3, sigma(He-3(gamma, np)p(sp)), where p(sp) is a spectator proton, is reported here for the first time. The E(gamma) dependence of the sigma is found to scale to that of sigma(H-2(gamma, np)), and the ratio is determined to be sigma(He-3(gamma, np)p(sp))/sigma(H-2(gamma, np)) = 1.24 +/- 0.26.

paper_title.en: Model Test of a Double-Coaxial λ/4 Resonant Cavity as a Rebuncher

publication_name.en: Proceedings of the 1994 International Linac Conference

research_project_title.ja: 高強度パルスビームによる星の中での12C(alpha, gamma)断面積測定
research_project_title.en: Cross section measurements of 12C(alpha, gamma) reactions by means of an intense pulsed beam

offer_organization.en: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

institution_name.ja: 大学共同利用機関法人高エネルギー加速器研究機構

description.ja: 星の中での重元素合成でキーとなる12C(α、γ)反応の断面積測定を行い、重心系のエネルギー2.1 MeVでのデータを得た。これにより実際に必要となる300 keVでの断面積を外挿で求めるときの精度を高めることができた。また、幾つかの理論的予測が棄却されることを示唆した。
description.en: We performed the cross section measurement at E(c. m.)=2.1MeV for the key reaction 12C(α、γ) of the element synthesis in stars. An important cross section at E(c. m.)=300 keV can be investigated in more precisely based on this data. And some theoretical predictions were excluded.

research_project_title.ja: 汎用FFAG加速器の応用と開発
research_project_title.en: Study of FFAG as a Versatile Accelerator for Applications

offer_organization.en: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science

description.ja: 本研究の柱となる.150MeV FFAG加速器の開発は研究期聞内に十分な成果をもって完了した。具体的には、新型FFAG電磁石である"リターンヨークフリー電磁石"12台から成るFFAG加速器本体を建設し、入射器サイクロトロンからの陽子ビームの入射、FFAG加速器での加速とビーム取り出し、さらに100Hz高繰り返し運転に成功した。また、入射されたビームを80%以上の効率で加速させることが出来、ビームの取り出し効率も90%以上を達成した。将来の粒子線がん治療において大きな期待を集めている高繰り返しパルスビームによるスポットスキャンニング基礎実験を行い、高繰り返しパルスビームの深さ方向線量分布測定を行い治療に適したブラッグピークを得ることができた。また、スポットスキャニングのためのファイバシンチレータと半導体ラインセンサを組み合わせた新しいタイプの測定装置の開発に成功した。リング小型化のために超伝導コイルを非対称に配置した従来にない方式の超伝導電磁石を考案した。この方式を実現するための超伝導コイルの巻き線手法として、巻き枠に直接ボンディングする6軸のCNC(計算機制御による巻き線機)を新たに開発し、プロトタイプ電磁石を製作し必要とされる磁場分布が十分な精度で実現されていることを確認した。これにより、楕円形状・大口径で高次の非線形磁場成分を大きく含む超伝導電磁石の技術的課題が解決され、これを用いた将来の超伝導FFAG加速器実現の可能性が大きく拓けた。
description.en: Development o 150MeV proton AG accelerator has been successfully completed in this study. The 150MeV proton AG accelerator consists of twelve magnets, each o which has a novel "return-york-free" configuration. We have successfully accelerated protons up to the maximum available energy in this ring with high repetition rate of 100Hz, which, is impossible or ordinary synchrotron and extracted them with high efficiency of more than 90%. We have made a basic experiment of fast spot scanning or future cancer therapy with high repetition beam and obtained a Bragg peak curve by measuring the depth-dependent dose. A new type of 2D detector or spot scanning with fiber scintillator and solid-state line sensing devices has been also successfully developed. In order to realize a small size FFAG ring in future, we have developed a prototype of novel super conducting magnet that composes of asymmetric coil configuration with newly developed computerized 6D coil winding machine (CNC). The magnetic field measurement has been carried out precisely or this prototype and the field quality was found to be excellent. We can summarize that this project has been successfully carried out and almost all issues that were aimed at the beginning have been completed with fruitful results.

research_project_title.ja: 第2バーンシュタインモード・複周波数加熱相乗型ECRイオン源の研究

description.ja:
Ku-Bandで動作する小型軽量級のECRイオン源を独自に設計製作し、これを用いて多価イオンビームを取り出し、ECR動作原理の拡張になりうる、実験研究をおこなっている。この研究に供する目的で製作したイオン源本体は、次のような特徴を持っている:
(1)必要なBmin構造の磁界をまず永久磁石だけで実現し、Bmin磁界付近だけを補助用の小型ソレノイドで補正変化可能にしたこと。
(2)通常のECR磁界に加えて、その1/2の第二バーンシュタインモードの共鳴帯の動作も可能にしたこと、
(3)これに関連してマイクロ波ポートも軸方向・径方向いずれからも同時入射可能な構成にしたこと、
(4)マイクロ波周波数も12-14.5GHzの範囲で連続可変かつパルス/CWの両モードで動作可能ならしめたこと。
平成8年度後半からこのような機能のイオン源とマイクロ波システムの設計製作を始めた。平成9年度前半に総合運転を行って多価イオンビームの初期取り出しに成功した。これらの機能をもつことにより、既にフランスで製作されている“NANOGAN"とはまたちがった、小型軽量のECRイオン源を実現することができた。このような小型軽量級のECRイオン源で、マイクロ波周波数をKu-Bandの帯域で連続可変動作させたのは、本邦で初めての試みである。

research_project_title.ja: VHSテープを使用した次世代マス・ストレージ・システムの開発研究

description.ja:
素粒子・原子核実験では、大量のデータ(〜1TB)を処理する必要がある。通常汎用大型計算機のテープ装置は、オープン・リール型又はカセット型である。これらのテープ媒体で1TBのデータは、5千本以上のテープとなり、その保管場所及びテープの取り扱いが問題となる。またワークステーションの標準的テープ媒体である、Exabyteテープは1本で2.5〜5GBの容量があるが、データ転送速度は500KB/秒と遅く大量データの扱いには問題が多い。このためExbyteテープと同じヘリカル・スキャン方式の、VHSテープを使用した汎用計算機用のテープシステムを構築した。VHSテープは、1本で14.5GBの容量を持ち、公称データ転送速度は2MB/秒で、外部機器との接続はSCSI(Small Computer System Interface)規格である。
東京大学原子核研究所の汎用大型計算機(FACOM M-780/10s)にVHSテープ装置を接続してマス・ストレージ・システムとすることを行った。汎用計算機のBMC(Block Multiplexer Channel)とVHSテープ装置のSCSIを接続するために、汎用計算機用インタフェースをティアック社で制作した。次いで各種のテストを実施した。FORTRANプログラムによる、VHSテープのwrite処理は1.7MB/秒、read処理は1.1MB/秒で、オープン・リール型テープよりも高性能である。VHSテープ用に変更したARCSプログラム(ディスク装置上のデータを退避・復元・複写・移行を高速に行うプログラム)による原子核研究所計算機システムのバックアップ(容量8.3GB)作業は、完全に無人状態で1台のVHS装置で約80分で終了した。通常この作業は4台のカセット型テープ装置と30本のテープを使用して、必要なテープを装着・脱着することにより30分程度の時間がかかる。このようにVHSテープ装置が、汎用機用の大容量テープ、マス・ストレージ・システムとして非常に有効であること実証した。

research_project_title.ja: 50GeV陽子シンクロトロン用電磁石の開発・研究
短寿命核用重イオン線型加速器の研究・開発

research_project_title.en: R&D of the Magets for 50-GeV Proton synchrotron
R&D of the Heavy Ion Linac Complex for Unstable Nuclei Beams
